heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 08 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 10.7°C), outside temperature (down 9.4°C), and inside temperature (down 3.6°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 5%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 423 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in outside temperature (up 10.7°C), cloud levels (up 403 m), and inside temperature (up 4.2°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 423.2m lower than yesterday, 288.1m lower than the past week, 403.4m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 993m to a maximum of 2630m, averaging 1199.3m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1487.5m and 1602.7m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: The sky may alternate between sunny and overcast.

summary.summary: Inside; on the cooler side. Outside; extremely cold temperatures will prevail. Also, very little to no wind will be present. A few light raindrops may fall, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and it’s dark. Weather should be calm and steady.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (1.2°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
